alert.note: Alert for Pecos; Terrell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 02 at 2:44PM CDT until June 02 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Central Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Northwestern Terrell County in southwestern Texas... * Until 330 PM CDT. * At 244 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located 24 miles southeast of Fort Stockton, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management confirmed tornado. Reports of tennis ball sized hail. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Pecos and northwestern Terrell Counties. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
